page.title: 07Changes in Mickleton 1955-85
page.content: Views of{Mr W Brain,}local resident. It was a big market gardening area where thousands of cauliflowers were grown.Horses were used on the land as well as tractors. An older resident{Mrs Elizabeth {Fairfax.} There are more strangers around now. There was a lot less traffic then and it went a lot slower.Mickleton had a population of 680 then.The centre of the village is much less pretty than it was.It used to have iron railings and bushes and more countryside.There are more shops now.The Post Office used to be at a house called Wycombe. There were more public houses.Three- Ways Hotel used to be a private house with a big garden behind a stone wall. Some of the old cottages have been pulled down.
